meanings.definition: Relating to a narrow range of environmental conditions.
meanings.sent1: The stenotopic plant only thrives in specific soil and sunlight conditions.
meanings.sent2: The stenotopic bird species can only survive in a particular type of habitat.
meanings.sent3: The stenotopic fish refused to swim in any water that wasn't exactly the right temperature.
meanings.sent4: Her stenotopic taste in music meant she only enjoyed one specific genre.
meanings.sent5: The stenotopic butterfly could only lay its eggs on a particular species of plant.

meanings.definition: Having a limited tolerance for certain environmental factors.
meanings.sent1: The stenotopic flower wilted quickly when exposed to too much sunlight.
meanings.sent2: The stenotopic patient had to avoid certain foods due to allergies.
meanings.sent3: The stenotopic cat sneezed uncontrollably around strong scents.
meanings.sent4: His stenotopic skin reacted badly to harsh chemicals in lotions.
meanings.sent5: The stenotopic dog could not handle being in crowded or noisy places.
